DOC.brief_title: Switch Atazanavir Brachial Artery Reactivity ( SABAR ) Study
DOC.detailed_description: HIV-infected subject stable protease inhibitor ( PI ) contain antiretroviral regimen plasma HIV RNA < 500 copies/mL , LDL cholesterol level > 130 mg/dL fast triglyceride level > 200 mg/dL , randomize ( 1:1 ) continue current antiretroviral regimen switch PI atazanavir ( ATV ) . Brachial artery reactivity measure ( entry ) 12 24 week subject randomize . ARM A : Switch current PI atazanavir 400 mg daily plus current > 2 nucleoside/nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitor ( NRTIs ) 24 week . Subjects currently ritonavir ( RTV ) ( 400 mg BID great ) RTV-boosted PI ( < 400 mg/day ) , tenofovir ( TDF ) backbone NRTI therapy , switch ATV 300 mg boost RTV 100mg daily . ARM B : Continue current antiretroviral regimen ( single RTV-boosted PI plus > 2 NRTIs ) 24 week Brachial artery reactivity response two vasoactive stimulus ( increase forearm blood flow nitroglycerin ) assess measure brachial artery diameter .
DOC.criteria: HIV infection HIV1 RNA < 500 copies/ml Fasting LDL cholesterol > 130 mg/dl OR fast triglyceride > 200 mg/dl CD4 count > 100 cells/mm Stable antiretroviral regimen least 12 week prior study entry include protease inhibitor ( PI ) without ritonavir boost History heart disease , uncontrolled hypertension , peripheral vascular disease Current nonnucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor ( NNRTI ) PIcontaining regimen within 4 week Prior current use atazanavir Initiation treatment lipidlowering drug within 4 week prior study entry
